reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is adequate for a stay in TJ. There was nothing special about this place. Its in a good part of TJ but down a dim lit street. The rooms were average. The service was average. The breakfast was good.
reviews.title: It was allright

reviews.text: I dont see why anyone would give it 5 stars???
reviews.title: Confusing but excellent stay

reviews.text: Very modern and chic-looking hotel in the nicer part of TJ, the Zona Rio. The staff was friendly and accomodating, despite a problem during check-in where I was informed that the room cost more than I reserved it for online. (I was about to be charged the regular price instead of the promo price I saw on their website, but they cleared it up when I told them that.) Confusion got worse with the room key, which is needed to power up the electricity in the room. And it continued when I realized there was no hotel binder in the room. I had to call the front desk with all my questions (ie, where's the room service menu?!), but I was always answered promptly (ie, the menu arrived at my room 2 minutes later). Nonetheless, the free wireless and local calls made up for any lack of understanding regarding the room. I would definitely stay here again. Real del Rio for the win!
reviews.title: GREAT stay at the Real Del Rio!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Real Del Rio for 14 days June/July 2009. I received EXCELLENT service. I was in the area for a medical procedure. This was my first time to travel outside of the US alone. I can without a doubt say that the Real Del Rio was safe, clean, accomadating, and excellent service! Many of the staff speak English. The Bell Boys, (Christian, Danny, and Manuel) were very helpful and took good geniune care of all of the customers. The maids were all kind and helpful. Bottled water delivered to room daily. Flat Screen TVs and Trendy New Decor. (recently remodeled) Beds were very comfortable and I had no problem getting extra pillows and blankets. Air worked so good - It was fantastic!! :) I was only a $5.00 cab ride from anything that I wanted and just a few minutes from the US. And the food was AMAZING!! Seriously, some of the best food ever!! The restuarant completely exceeded all expectations. Room service was fast and friendly. Excellent choice if you are staying in the TJ area. I would highly recommend the Real Del Rio!!
reviews.title: Hotel Real del Rio has great service

reviews.text: What a sweet staff! I ahd to ahve surgery and they were very kind from the front desk ladies to the bell-boys.The room was lovely; air-conditioner could have been a little easier to set, either too hot or too cold, but it might have just been my room...I would go there again in a minute....The rates are very resonable....
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

reviews.text: I was very scared to stay in Tijuana from all of the bad stories I have heard, but I had no choice because I was there to get a surgery done at Elite Plastic Surgery. This is the hotel my surgeon recommended I stay at. My girlfriend and I stayed there for 3 days, in a double occupancy room. The room included a flat screen tv, nice, big shower, a safe for my valuables, and it was very well kept up and clean. I ordered room service and I felt like a King staying in a castle. I highly recommend the cream chees crepes! Not to mention the general manager, Pablo, surpassed my expectations by visiting us in our room and welcoming us to the hotel. He reassured us that anything we needed, he would gladly give to us. The first night we stayed there, we received a complimentary delicious treat at our door. That put the icing on the cake for my pleasant stay. I recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to go to Tijuana. Everyone there was very friendly.
reviews.title: This Hotel Superceded My Expectations!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow wow wow. Real de Rio made us feel at home. Although the hotel was going through some renovations on the interior and exterior it didn't bother us one bit. The staff from the time we arrived were great. The young bellman who took our bags to our room was funny and very welcoming. They supplied us with a refrigerator and when my father asked for a extension cord for his "breathing machine" they brought one right away. The rooms where new from the beds, to the tile to the art work. Rooms where modern and roomy. Below the hotel is parking which is watched by 2 security guards!
reviews.title: Modern, Excellent Staff and great Rates

reviews.text: When we arrived there was an odor in the bathroom, kinda like mold. We weren't sure what it was since it appeared that everything in the restroom was newly remodeled. But when we did mention it, with in 5min a maintenance gal came up and did her magic and after that it never appeared to smell again, WOW. About 1/2hr after we had a visit from Pablo the Hotel director. He was great, very stylish and super friendly. He asked how our stay was going, if we needed anything and if maintenance had fixed our small issue. We then asked if he knew of a place to get our hair done. He was quick to call his daughter and ask for a great salon near by.
reviews.title: Boutique hotel with beautiful rooms and a great price

reviews.text: About 15min after he left there was a knock at our door and a staff member brought up a huge plate of complimentary desserts! Crepes with fresh strawberries and a humungo piece of the most delicious cake!
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Tijuana!!

reviews.text: They made us very at home, we are going back in 2weeks and are definitely staying there again!
reviews.title: What a beautiful Personal experience

likes.liked: — The Bedding and the beds were so comfortable and it was so clean
likes.disliked: — That I had to go home!!!!

reviews.text: My wife & I visited Tijuana almost 4 years ago and had a great time at Hotel La Villa de Zaragoza. While we were initially tempted to book there again this time around, I couldn’t help noticing that the hotel had dropped significantly on the popularity index on Trip Advisor and the Hotel Real del Rio was listed rather high at #4.
reviews.title: Where do I begin!?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a mistake that was! I booked two non smoking rooms from May 4 – 6: one for my parents and the other for my wife and me. The bellhop took us to the first room that was rather warm with a strong pungent odor and a huge stain in the middle of the floor, then to the second room which was smaller but much nicer. Immediately, we realized that no one wanted to stay (or could stay) in the first room so we asked room service for a room just like the second one which my parents claimed as their own. The hotel told us that they didn’t have one ready but would so in about 15 minutes. Almost an hour later, my wife and I were still stuck in my parents’ room waiting for our own room. I called downstairs and they said it would be a few minutes more. Fifteen minutes later, nothing. I was too upset to deal with these folks again so my dad decided to call downstairs and we all started to walk around trying to find the room that was taking over an hour to clean. We were told that it was #421 which we discovered had been ready since the housekeeping lady was now cleaning room #420.
reviews.title: Noisy and under renovation

reviews.text: After this fiasco, we asked where the ice machine was and the hotel insisted they would bring the ice up which they did, about 2 handfuls worth earning the bellboy his obligatory tip. Amazingly enough, as there is no access to a microwave anywhere, warming up leftovers or coffee is out of the question. In fact, I had to ask the lady at the restaurant if she would be kind enough to warm up a cup of coffee that I had bought in Starbucks earlier and to her credit she did her best, bringing me back a lukewarm cup.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: Did I mention that the phone in our room didn’t work either and the hair dryer suddenly stopped working (and not because it was over heated)? I wish this was everything but it’s not.
reviews.title: I Love Love Love The Del Rio!!!

reviews.text: The elevator doors stay open for about two seconds before they try to crush you. That certainly needs to be fixed.
reviews.title: Best crepes anywhere!

reviews.text: The newly remodeled rooms are absolutely beautiful. The decor is modern, spacious and tastefully decorated. The premises are crisp and clean.
reviews.title: Hotel Real del Rio, the place to stay while visiting tijuana
The Suite was Awesome
reviews.text: For a delicious meal dine at the on-site restaurant,Miel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best Margaritas in town can be found in the bar. They are made differently than any Margarita I've ever had. The Tequila is poured into the glass and the blended mix poured over it.
reviews.title: woderful staff, excellent stay

reviews.text: The hotel staff are professional and friendly. The general manager, Pablo Orozco, took extra care to ensure my stay was carefree and enjoyable.
reviews.title: Good value and location, but mediocre experience

likes.disliked: — Lack of amenities, street noise, quality of restaurant food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am looking forward to returning in the very near future.
reviews.title: Very Nice Friendly Hotel and Security Parking
